title: Welcome to Country Shapes 101
body: We'll learn to recognise South & Central-American countries from their outlines.

title: South America overview
body: Argentina; Bolivia; Brazil; Chile; Colombia; Ecuador; Guyana; Paraguay; Peru; Suriname; Uruguay; Venezuela

title: Central America overview
body: Belize; Costa Rica; El Salvador; Guatemala; Honduras; Nicaragua; Panama

title: Neighbouring countries – South America
body: Argentina: Chile, Bolivia, Paraguay, Brazil, Uruguay; Bolivia: Peru, Brazil, Paraguay, Argentina, Chile; Brazil: Uruguay, Argentina, Paraguay, Bolivia, Peru, Colombia, Venezuela, Guyana, Suriname; Chile: Peru, Bolivia, Argentina; Colombia: Venezuela, Brazil, Peru, Ecuador, Panama; Ecuador: Colombia, Peru; Guyana: Venezuela, Brazil, Suriname; Paraguay: Bolivia, Brazil, Argentina; Peru: Ecuador, Colombia, Brazil, Bolivia, Chile; Suriname: Guyana, Brazil; Uruguay: Brazil, Argentina; Venezuela: Colombia, Brazil, Guyana;

title: Neighbouring countries – Central America
body: Belize: Mexico, Guatemala; Costa Rica: Nicaragua, Panama; El Salvador: Guatemala, Honduras; Guatemala: Mexico, Belize, Honduras, El Salvador; Honduras: Guatemala, El Salvador, Nicaragua; Nicaragua: Honduras, Costa Rica; Panama: Costa Rica, Colombia

title: In-depth: Brazil
body: The largest country in South America by area; Roughly circular shape, bulging eastward; Borders nearly every South American country (except Chile & Ecuador); Home to the Amazon Rainforest.

title: In-depth: Chile
body: Extremely long and narrow – stretches along the Pacific coast; Shares the Andes Mountains border with Argentina; Touches Peru to the north and Antarctica to the south.

title: In-depth: Colombia
body: Northwestern location near Central America; Touches both the Caribbean Sea and Pacific Ocean; Borders Venezuela, Brazil, Peru, Ecuador, and Panama.

title: In-depth: Peru
body: Western coast country just south of Ecuador and Colombia; Shares Amazon Basin with Brazil; Borders the Pacific Ocean and Andes mountains.

title: In-depth: El Salvador
body: Smallest country in Central America; Bordered by Guatemala to the west and Honduras to the north and east; The country experiences two main seasons: the dry season (November to April) and the rainy season (May to October); Only Central American country without a Caribbean coastline; Known as the 'Land of Volcanoes' for its 23 active volcanoes.

title: In-depth: Venezuela
body: Northern coast along the Caribbean Sea; Eastern neighbor to Colombia; Western neighbor to Guyana; Often shaped like a triangle or "chopped square."

title: In-depth: Costa Rica
body: Located between Nicaragua and Panama; Has coastlines on both the Caribbean Sea and Pacific Ocean; It's one of the world's leading eco-tourism destinations, with approximately 25% of its territory protected as national parks and reserves; The country is home to about 5% of the world's biodiversity despite occupying only 0.03% of the planet's surface; Has no standing army since 1949.
